channel.title: Compile!
channel.description:
what do i write in the compile to make it compile proply or have i got it right. this is ringerscape II source. (updated version of testscape)
[code]@echo off COLOR 08 title Wii-Scape Client "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06injavac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:Program FilesJavajre1.5.0_08injava.exe" server pause[/code][br][size=1]Posted at: September 03, 2006, 12:37:46 AM[/size][hr]or which one would compile it
compile, nconpile, run or runserver.
i clicked one after other and logged on my server and the things i change didnt change....

item.title: Compile!
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

On another topic

yogosun, unfortunately ringerscape has illegaly taken my servermanager, which requires a classpath to be set (for several imports) therefore you need to run ncompile then run.bat, should work fine.

javac -cp . *.java
?

item.title: Compile!
item.dc:creator: @Yogosun Yogosun
item.description:
@Yogosun wrote:

Only 1 command compiles things is this…

[color=green]javac *.java[/color]

But you can make it compile and then wait for you to close the screen manually by adding this

[color=green]javac *.java
pause[/color]

and hide all the informaiton you see by adding this

[color=green]@echo off
javac *.java
pause[/color]

Give it a title

[color=green]title Whatever Compiler
color 2
javac *.java
pause[/color]

And give it some nice pretty coloured text…

[color=green]@echo off
title StormScape Compiler
color 2
javac *.java
pause[/color]

but [color=green]javac *.java [/color] is the command that turnes all JAVA files into CLASS files
just have the Batch file in the same directory as your Java files and press compile.
Easy.

Read full topic
